title: Finding Your Path
subtitle: When you don't know what you want
description: For those who feel lost, stuck, or unclear about direction. This course helps you cut through confusion, reconnect with what matters to you, and take steps forward even when the whole path isn't visible.

modules.title: Understanding Lostness
modules.description: Why you feel stuck and what it means

modules.title: Clearing the Noise
modules.description: Separating your voice from others' expectations

modules.title: Following Your Energy
modules.description: What enlivens you points the way

modules.title: Experiments, Not Plans
modules.description: Moving forward without having it all figured out

modules.title: Working with Fear
modules.description: When fear blocks the path forward

modules.title: Trusting the Process
modules.description: The path reveals itself through walking

whatYouLearn: Understand why you feel lost or stuck
Distinguish your desires from others' expectations
Use energy and aliveness as guidance
Take action through experiments rather than requiring certainty
Work with fear that blocks forward movement
requirements: Currently feeling lost, stuck, or unclear about direction

questions.question: What does feeling 'lost' often indicate?
options: A transition point where old structures no longer work and new ones haven't formed

questions.question: Why is it important to separate your voice from others' expectations?
options: Following others' expectations leads to paths that aren't truly yours

questions.question: What does 'following your energy' mean?
options: Paying attention to what genuinely enlivens and interests you as guidance

questions.question: Why experiments rather than plans?
options: You can't know if something works until you try—small experiments reveal the path

questions.question: What role does fear play when finding your path?
options: Fear often guards the edge of growth—it's information, not a stop sign

questions.question: What does 'the path reveals itself through walking' mean?
options: You can't see the whole path before starting—clarity comes through action
